src.tui

Terminal UI package for DShield MCP Server.

This package provides a terminal-based user interface for managing the DShield MCP server, including connection management, monitoring, and control.

 1#!/usr/bin/env python3
 2"""Terminal UI package for DShield MCP Server.
 3
 4This package provides a terminal-based user interface for managing the
 5DShield MCP server, including connection management, monitoring, and control.
 6"""
 7
 8from .connection_panel import ConnectionPanel
 9from .log_panel import LogPanel
10from .server_panel import ServerPanel
11from .status_bar import StatusBar
12from .tui_app import DShieldTUIApp

class ConnectionPanel(textual.containers.Container): 
 86class ConnectionPanel(Container):
 87    """Panel for managing TCP connections and API keys.
 88
 89    This panel displays active connections, allows disconnecting clients,
 90    and provides API key management functionality.
 91    """
 92
 93    def __init__(self, id: str = "connection-panel", refresh_interval: float = 5.0) -> None:
 94        """Initialize the connection panel.
 95
 96        Args:
 97            id: Panel ID
 98            refresh_interval: Refresh interval in seconds
 99
100        """
101        super().__init__(id=id)
102        self.logger = structlog.get_logger(f"{__name__}.{self.__class__.__name__}")
103
104        # State
105        self.connections: list[dict[str, Any]] = []
106        self.api_keys: list[dict[str, Any]] = []
107        self.filtered_connections: list[dict[str, Any]] = []
108        self.selected_connection: str | None = None
109        self.selected_api_key_id: str | None = None
110        
111        # Filtering and pagination
112        self.filter_text: str = ""
113        self.current_page: int = 0
114        self.page_size: int = 20
115        
116        # Refresh management
117        self.refresh_interval: float = refresh_interval
118        self.refresh_task: asyncio.Task[None] | None = None
119        self.is_refreshing: bool = False
120
121    def compose(self) -> ComposeResult:
122        """Compose the connection panel layout.
123
124        Returns:
125            ComposeResult: The composed UI elements
126
127        """
128        yield Static("Connection Management", classes="panel-title")
129
130        with Vertical(classes="panel"):
131            # Connection controls
132            with Horizontal(classes="connection-controls"):
133                yield Button("Disconnect Selected", id="disconnect-btn", disabled=True)
134                yield Button("Disconnect All", id="disconnect-all-btn")
135                yield Button("Refresh", id="refresh-connections-btn")
136                yield Button("Auto Refresh", id="auto-refresh-btn")
137
138            # Connection filter
139            with Horizontal(classes="connection-filter"):
140                yield Static("Filter:", classes="filter-label")
141                yield Input(
142                    placeholder="Filter by address or key ID...", 
143                    id="connection-filter-input"
144                )
145
146            # Connections table
147            yield Static("Active Connections:", classes="section-title")
148            yield DataTable(id="connections-table")
149
150            # Pagination controls
151            with Horizontal(classes="pagination-controls"):
152                yield Button("Previous", id="prev-page-btn", disabled=True)
153                yield Static("Page 1 of 1", id="page-info")
154                yield Button("Next", id="next-page-btn", disabled=True)
155
156            # API Key controls
157            with Horizontal(classes="api-key-controls"):
158                yield Button("Generate API Key", id="generate-api-key-btn")
159                yield Button("Revoke Selected", id="revoke-api-key-btn", disabled=True)
160                yield Button("Refresh Keys", id="refresh-keys-btn")
161
162            # API Keys table
163            yield Static("API Keys:", classes="section-title")
164            yield DataTable(id="api-keys-table")
165
166    def on_mount(self) -> None:
167        """Handle panel mount event."""
168        self.logger.debug("Connection panel mounted")
169
170        # Initialize connections table with enhanced columns
171        connections_table = self.query_one("#connections-table", DataTable)
172        connections_table.add_columns(
173            "Client Address",
174            "Key ID",
175            "Permissions",
176            "RPS",
177            "Violations",
178            "Connected At",
179            "Status",
180        )
181
182        # Initialize API keys table
183        api_keys_table = self.query_one("#api-keys-table", DataTable)
184        api_keys_table.add_columns(
185            "Key ID",
186            "Created",
187            "Expires",
188            "Permissions",
189            "Active Sessions",
190        )
191
192        # Start auto-refresh if enabled
193        self._start_auto_refresh()
194
195    def update_connections(self, connections: list[dict[str, Any]]) -> None:
196        """Update the connections display.
197
198        Args:
199            connections: List of connection information
200
201        """
202        self.connections = connections
203        self._apply_filter()
204        self._update_connections_display()
205
206    def _apply_filter(self) -> None:
207        """Apply current filter to connections."""
208        if not self.filter_text:
209            self.filtered_connections = self.connections.copy()
210        else:
211            filter_lower = self.filter_text.lower()
212            self.filtered_connections = [
213                conn for conn in self.connections
214                if (filter_lower in str(conn.get("client_address", "")).lower() or
215                    filter_lower in str(conn.get("api_key_id", "")).lower() or
216                    filter_lower in str(conn.get("key_id", "")).lower())
217            ]
218
219    def _update_connections_display(self) -> None:
220        """Update the connections table display."""
221        connections_table = self.query_one("#connections-table", DataTable)
222        
223        # Clear existing data
224        connections_table.clear()
225
226        # Calculate pagination
227        total_pages = max(
228            1, (len(self.filtered_connections) + self.page_size - 1) // self.page_size
229        )
230        self.current_page = min(self.current_page, total_pages - 1)
231        
232        start_idx = self.current_page * self.page_size
233        end_idx = start_idx + self.page_size
234        page_connections = self.filtered_connections[start_idx:end_idx]
235
236        # Add connection data with enhanced information
237        for conn in page_connections:
238            # Format permissions
239            permissions = conn.get("permissions", {})
240            if isinstance(permissions, dict):
241                perm_str = ", ".join([f"{k}: {v}" for k, v in permissions.items() if v])
242            else:
243                perm_str = str(permissions) if permissions else "None"
244
245            # Format connected_at timestamp
246            connected_at = conn.get("connected_at")
247            if connected_at:
248                if isinstance(connected_at, str):
249                    try:
250                        dt = datetime.fromisoformat(connected_at.replace('Z', '+00:00'))
251                        connected_str = dt.strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
252                    except ValueError:
253                        connected_str = str(connected_at)
254                else:
255                    connected_str = str(connected_at)
256            else:
257                connected_str = "Unknown"
258
259            # Determine status
260            status = "Active"
261            if not conn.get("is_authenticated", False):
262                status = "Unauthenticated"
263            elif conn.get("violations", 0) > 0:
264                status = "Violations"
265
266            connections_table.add_row(
267                str(conn.get("client_address", "Unknown")),
268                str(conn.get("api_key_id", conn.get("key_id", "N/A"))),
269                perm_str,
270                str(conn.get("rps", conn.get("requests_per_second", 0))),
271                str(conn.get("violations", 0)),
272                connected_str,
273                status,
274            )
275
276        # Update pagination controls
277        self._update_pagination_controls(total_pages)
278
279        self.logger.debug(
280            "Updated connections display", 
281            total=len(self.connections),
282            filtered=len(self.filtered_connections),
283            page=self.current_page + 1,
284            total_pages=total_pages
285        )
286
287    def _update_pagination_controls(self, total_pages: int) -> None:
288        """Update pagination control states.
289
290        Args:
291            total_pages: Total number of pages
292
293        """
294        try:
295            prev_btn = self.query_one("#prev-page-btn", Button)
296            next_btn = self.query_one("#next-page-btn", Button)
297            page_info = self.query_one("#page-info", Static)
298
299            # Update button states
300            prev_btn.disabled = self.current_page <= 0
301            next_btn.disabled = self.current_page >= total_pages - 1
302
303            # Update page info
304            page_info.update(f"Page {self.current_page + 1} of {total_pages}")
305        except Exception as e:
306            self.logger.warning("Error updating pagination controls", error=str(e))
307
308    def _start_auto_refresh(self) -> None:
309        """Start auto-refresh task."""
310        if self.refresh_task and not self.refresh_task.done():
311            self.refresh_task.cancel()
312        
313        self.refresh_task = asyncio.create_task(self._auto_refresh_loop())
314
315    def _stop_auto_refresh(self) -> None:
316        """Stop auto-refresh task."""
317        if self.refresh_task and not self.refresh_task.done():
318            self.refresh_task.cancel()
319            self.refresh_task = None
320
321    async def _auto_refresh_loop(self) -> None:
322        """Auto-refresh loop."""
323        while True:
324            try:
325                await asyncio.sleep(self.refresh_interval)
326                if not self.is_refreshing:
327                    self.post_message(ConnectionRefresh())
328            except asyncio.CancelledError:
329                break
330            except Exception as e:
331                self.logger.error("Error in auto-refresh loop", error=str(e))
332
333    def update_api_keys(self, api_keys: list[dict[str, Any]]) -> None:
334        """Update the API keys display.
335
336        Args:
337            api_keys: List of API key information
338
339        """
340        self.logger.debug("update_api_keys called", api_keys_count=len(api_keys), api_keys=api_keys)
341        self.api_keys = api_keys
342
343        try:
344            api_keys_table = self.query_one("#api-keys-table", DataTable)
345            self.logger.debug("Found API keys table")
346
347            # Clear existing data
348            api_keys_table.clear()
349            self.logger.debug("Cleared API keys table")
350
351            # Add API key data
352            for key in api_keys:
353                permissions = key.get("permissions", {})
354                permissions_str = ", ".join([f"{k}: {v}" for k, v in permissions.items() if v])
355
356                api_keys_table.add_row(
357                    key.get("key_id", "Unknown"),
358                    key.get("created_at", "Unknown"),
359                    key.get("expires_at", "Unknown"),
360                    permissions_str or "None",
361                    str(key.get("active_sessions", 0)),
362                )
363                self.logger.debug("Added API key row", key_id=key.get("key_id"))
364
365            self.logger.debug("Updated API keys display", count=len(api_keys))
366
367        except Exception as e:
368            self.logger.error("Error updating API keys display", error=str(e))
369
370    def on_button_pressed(self, event: Button.Pressed) -> None:
371        """Handle button press events.
372
373        Args:
374            event: Button press event
375
376        """
377        button_id = event.button.id
378
379        if button_id == "disconnect-btn":
380            self._disconnect_selected_connection()
381        elif button_id == "disconnect-all-btn":
382            self._disconnect_all_connections()
383        elif button_id == "refresh-connections-btn":
384            self._refresh_connections()
385        elif button_id == "auto-refresh-btn":
386            self._toggle_auto_refresh()
387        elif button_id == "prev-page-btn":
388            self._previous_page()
389        elif button_id == "next-page-btn":
390            self._next_page()
391        elif button_id == "generate-api-key-btn":
392            self._generate_api_key()
393        elif button_id == "revoke-api-key-btn":
394            self._revoke_selected_api_key()
395        elif button_id == "refresh-keys-btn":
396            self._refresh_api_keys()
397
398    def on_data_table_row_selected(self, event: DataTable.RowSelected) -> None:
399        """Handle data table row selection.
400
401        Args:
402            event: Row selection event
403
404        """
405        table_id = event.data_table.id
406
407        if table_id == "connections-table":
408            self._select_connection(event.row_key)
409        elif table_id == "api-keys-table":
410            self._select_api_key(event.row_key)
411
412    def on_input_changed(self, event: Input.Changed) -> None:
413        """Handle input change events.
414
415        Args:
416            event: Input change event
417
418        """
419        if event.input.id == "connection-filter-input":
420            self.filter_text = event.value
421            self.current_page = 0  # Reset to first page when filtering
422            self._apply_filter()
423            self._update_connections_display()
424            self.logger.debug("Filter applied", filter_text=self.filter_text)
425
426    def _disconnect_selected_connection(self) -> None:
427        """Disconnect the selected connection."""
428        if not self.selected_connection:
429            return
430
431        self.logger.info(
432            "Disconnecting selected connection", client_address=self.selected_connection
433        )
434
435        # Post disconnect message
436        self.post_message(ConnectionDisconnect(self.selected_connection))
437
438        # Clear selection
439        self.selected_connection = None
440        self.query_one("#disconnect-btn", Button).disabled = True
441
442    def _disconnect_all_connections(self) -> None:
443        """Disconnect all active connections."""
444        self.logger.info("Disconnecting all connections")
445
446        # Post disconnect messages for all connections
447        for conn in self.connections:
448            client_address = conn.get("client_address")
449            if client_address:
450                self.post_message(ConnectionDisconnect(str(client_address)))
451
452    def _refresh_connections(self) -> None:
453        """Refresh the connections display."""
454        self.logger.debug("Refreshing connections")
455        self.is_refreshing = True
456        try:
457            # Post refresh message to parent application
458            self.post_message(ConnectionRefresh())
459        finally:
460            self.is_refreshing = False
461
462    def _toggle_auto_refresh(self) -> None:
463        """Toggle auto-refresh functionality."""
464        if self.refresh_task and not self.refresh_task.done():
465            self._stop_auto_refresh()
466            self.query_one("#auto-refresh-btn", Button).label = "Auto Refresh"
467            self.logger.debug("Auto-refresh stopped")
468        else:
469            self._start_auto_refresh()
470            self.query_one("#auto-refresh-btn", Button).label = "Stop Auto"
471            self.logger.debug("Auto-refresh started")
472
473    def _previous_page(self) -> None:
474        """Go to previous page."""
475        if self.current_page > 0:
476            self.current_page -= 1
477            self._update_connections_display()
478            self.logger.debug("Moved to previous page", page=self.current_page + 1)
479
480    def _next_page(self) -> None:
481        """Go to next page."""
482        total_pages = max(
483            1, (len(self.filtered_connections) + self.page_size - 1) // self.page_size
484        )
485        if self.current_page < total_pages - 1:
486            self.current_page += 1
487            self._update_connections_display()
488            self.logger.debug("Moved to next page", page=self.current_page + 1)
489
490    def _generate_api_key(self) -> None:
491        """Generate a new API key."""
492        self.logger.info("Generating new API key")
493
494        # Post API key generation message
495        self.post_message(APIKeyGenerate())
496
497    def _revoke_selected_api_key(self) -> None:
498        """Revoke the selected API key."""
499        if not hasattr(self, 'selected_api_key_id') or not self.selected_api_key_id:
500            self.notify("No API key selected", severity="error")
501            return
502
503        self.logger.info("Revoking selected API key", key_id=self.selected_api_key_id)
504        
505        # Post API key revocation message
506        self.post_message(APIKeyRevoke(self.selected_api_key_id))
507        
508        # Clear selection
509        self.selected_api_key_id = None
510        self.query_one("#revoke-api-key-btn", Button).disabled = True
511
512    def _refresh_api_keys(self) -> None:
513        """Refresh the API keys display."""
514        self.logger.debug("Refreshing API keys")
515        # This would trigger a refresh from the parent application
516
517    def _select_connection(self, row_key: Any) -> None:
518        """Select a connection.
519
520        Args:
521            row_key: Row key of the selected connection
522
523        """
524        # Calculate actual index in filtered connections
525        start_idx = self.current_page * self.page_size
526        actual_idx = start_idx + row_key
527        
528        if 0 <= actual_idx < len(self.filtered_connections):
529            conn = self.filtered_connections[actual_idx]
530            self.selected_connection = str(conn.get("client_address", ""))
531
532            # Enable disconnect button
533            self.query_one("#disconnect-btn", Button).disabled = False
534
535            self.logger.debug("Selected connection", client_address=self.selected_connection)
536
537    def _select_api_key(self, row_key: Any) -> None:
538        """Select an API key.
539
540        Args:
541            row_key: Row key of the selected API key
542
543        """
544        if row_key < len(self.api_keys):
545            key = self.api_keys[row_key]
546            key_id = key.get("key_id", "")
547            
548            # Store the selected key ID
549            self.selected_api_key_id = key_id
550
551            # Enable revoke button
552            self.query_one("#revoke-api-key-btn", Button).disabled = False
553
554            self.logger.debug("Selected API key", key_id=key_id)
555
556    def get_connection_statistics(self) -> dict[str, Any]:
557        """Get connection statistics.
558
559        Returns:
560            Dictionary of connection statistics
561
562        """
563        total_connections = len(self.connections)
564        authenticated_connections = len(
565            [conn for conn in self.connections if conn.get("is_authenticated", False)]
566        )
567        initialized_connections = len(
568            [conn for conn in self.connections if conn.get("is_initialized", False)]
569        )
570        connections_with_violations = len(
571            [conn for conn in self.connections if conn.get("violations", 0) > 0]
572        )
573        
574        # Calculate average RPS
575        total_rps = sum(
576            conn.get("rps", conn.get("requests_per_second", 0)) 
577            for conn in self.connections
578        )
579        avg_rps = total_rps / total_connections if total_connections > 0 else 0
580
581        return {
582            "total_connections": total_connections,
583            "authenticated_connections": authenticated_connections,
584            "initialized_connections": initialized_connections,
585            "unauthenticated_connections": total_connections - authenticated_connections,
586            "uninitialized_connections": total_connections - initialized_connections,
587            "connections_with_violations": connections_with_violations,
588            "average_rps": round(avg_rps, 2),
589            "filtered_connections": len(self.filtered_connections),
590        }
591
592    def get_api_key_statistics(self) -> dict[str, Any]:
593        """Get API key statistics.
594
595        Returns:
596            Dictionary of API key statistics
597
598        """
599        total_keys = len(self.api_keys)
600        active_keys = len([key for key in self.api_keys if key.get("active_sessions", 0) > 0])
601
602        return {
603            "total_api_keys": total_keys,
604            "active_api_keys": active_keys,
605            "inactive_api_keys": total_keys - active_keys,
606        }
607
608    def cleanup(self) -> None:
609        """Cleanup resources when panel is destroyed."""
610        self._stop_auto_refresh()
611        self.logger.debug("Connection panel cleaned up")
612
613    def on_unmount(self) -> None:
614        """Handle panel unmount event."""
615        self.cleanup()

def update_api_keys(self, api_keys: list[dict[str, typing.Any]]) -> None: 
333    def update_api_keys(self, api_keys: list[dict[str, Any]]) -> None:
334        """Update the API keys display.
335
336        Args:
337            api_keys: List of API key information
338
339        """
340        self.logger.debug("update_api_keys called", api_keys_count=len(api_keys), api_keys=api_keys)
341        self.api_keys = api_keys
342
343        try:
344            api_keys_table = self.query_one("#api-keys-table", DataTable)
345            self.logger.debug("Found API keys table")
346
347            # Clear existing data
348            api_keys_table.clear()
349            self.logger.debug("Cleared API keys table")
350
351            # Add API key data
352            for key in api_keys:
353                permissions = key.get("permissions", {})
354                permissions_str = ", ".join([f"{k}: {v}" for k, v in permissions.items() if v])
355
356                api_keys_table.add_row(
357                    key.get("key_id", "Unknown"),
358                    key.get("created_at", "Unknown"),
359                    key.get("expires_at", "Unknown"),
360                    permissions_str or "None",
361                    str(key.get("active_sessions", 0)),
362                )
363                self.logger.debug("Added API key row", key_id=key.get("key_id"))
364
365            self.logger.debug("Updated API keys display", count=len(api_keys))
366
367        except Exception as e:
368            self.logger.error("Error updating API keys display", error=str(e))

def get_connection_statistics(self) -> dict[str, typing.Any]: 
556    def get_connection_statistics(self) -> dict[str, Any]:
557        """Get connection statistics.
558
559        Returns:
560            Dictionary of connection statistics
561
562        """
563        total_connections = len(self.connections)
564        authenticated_connections = len(
565            [conn for conn in self.connections if conn.get("is_authenticated", False)]
566        )
567        initialized_connections = len(
568            [conn for conn in self.connections if conn.get("is_initialized", False)]
569        )
570        connections_with_violations = len(
571            [conn for conn in self.connections if conn.get("violations", 0) > 0]
572        )
573        
574        # Calculate average RPS
575        total_rps = sum(
576            conn.get("rps", conn.get("requests_per_second", 0)) 
577            for conn in self.connections
578        )
579        avg_rps = total_rps / total_connections if total_connections > 0 else 0
580
581        return {
582            "total_connections": total_connections,
583            "authenticated_connections": authenticated_connections,
584            "initialized_connections": initialized_connections,
585            "unauthenticated_connections": total_connections - authenticated_connections,
586            "uninitialized_connections": total_connections - initialized_connections,
587            "connections_with_violations": connections_with_violations,
588            "average_rps": round(avg_rps, 2),
589            "filtered_connections": len(self.filtered_connections),
590        }

Get connection statistics.

Returns: Dictionary of connection statistics

def get_api_key_statistics(self) -> dict[str, typing.Any]: 
592    def get_api_key_statistics(self) -> dict[str, Any]:
593        """Get API key statistics.
594
595        Returns:
596            Dictionary of API key statistics
597
598        """
599        total_keys = len(self.api_keys)
600        active_keys = len([key for key in self.api_keys if key.get("active_sessions", 0) > 0])
601
602        return {
603            "total_api_keys": total_keys,
604            "active_api_keys": active_keys,
605            "inactive_api_keys": total_keys - active_keys,
606        }

Get API key statistics.

Returns: Dictionary of API key statistics

155    def __init__(self, config_path: str | None = None) -> None:
156        """Initialize the TUI application.
157
158        Args:
159            config_path: Optional path to configuration file
160
161        """
162        super().__init__()
163        self.config_path = config_path
164        self.user_config = UserConfigManager(config_path)
165        self.logger = structlog.get_logger(f"{__name__}.{self.__class__.__name__}")
166
167        # Server components
168        self.tcp_server: EnhancedTCPServer | None = None
169        self.server_process: subprocess.Popen[bytes] | None = None
170        self.server_thread: threading.Thread | None = None
171        self.server_running = reactive(False)
172        self.server_port = reactive(self.user_config.tcp_transport_settings.port)
173
174        # UI state
175        self._mounted = False
176        self.server_address = reactive(self.user_config.tcp_transport_settings.bind_address)
177        self.current_panel = 0
178        self.log_entries: list[dict[str, Any]] = []
179        self.connections: list[dict[str, Any]] = []
180        self.server_status: dict[str, Any] = {}
181
182        # Update tasks
183        self._update_task: asyncio.Task[Any] | threading.Thread | None = None
184
185    def compose(self) -> ComposeResult:
186        """Compose the TUI layout.
187
188        Returns:
189            ComposeResult: The composed UI elements
190
191        """
192        yield Header()
193
194        with Container(id="main-container"):
195            with Container(id="left-panel"):
196                yield ConnectionPanel(id="connection-panel")
197                yield ServerPanel(id="server-panel", config_path=self.config_path)
198
199            with Container(id="right-panel"):
200                yield LogPanel(id="log-panel")
201
202        yield StatusBar(id="status-bar")
203        yield Footer()
204
205    def on_mount(self) -> None:
206        """Handle application mount event."""
207        self.logger.info("TUI application mounted")
208        self.title = "DShield MCP Server Manager"
209        self.sub_title = f"Port: {self.server_port} | Address: {self.server_address}"
210
211        # Mark UI as mounted
212        self._mounted = True
213
214        # Start update task in a separate thread
215        self._update_task = threading.Thread(target=self._periodic_update, daemon=True)
216        self._update_task.start()
217
218        # Auto-start server if configured
219        if self.user_config.tui_settings.server_management.get("auto_start_server", True):
220            self.action_restart_server()
221
222        # Add a test log entry to verify log panel is working
223        self._add_log_entry("info", "TUI application started successfully")
224
225    def on_unmount(self) -> None:
226        """Handle application unmount event."""
227        self.logger.info("TUI application unmounting")
228
229        # Stop update task
230        if (
231            self._update_task
232            and hasattr(self._update_task, "is_alive")
233            and self._update_task.is_alive()
234        ):
235            # The thread will stop when the daemon process exits
236            pass
237
238        # Stop server
239        if self.server_running:
240            self.action_stop_server()
241
242    def _periodic_update(self) -> None:
243        """Periodic update task for refreshing UI data."""
244        import time
245
246        while True:
247            try:
248                time.sleep(self.user_config.tui_settings.refresh_interval_ms / 1000.0)
249                self._update_ui_data()
250            except Exception as e:
251                self.logger.error("Error in periodic update", error=str(e))
252
253    def _update_ui_data(self) -> None:
254        """Update UI data from server components."""
255        try:
256            # Check if the UI is mounted before trying to update panels
257            if not hasattr(self, "_mounted") or not self._mounted:
258                self.logger.debug("UI not mounted yet, skipping update")
259                return
260
261            # Update server status
262            if self.tcp_server:
263                self.server_status = self.tcp_server.get_server_statistics()
264                self.post_message(ServerStatusUpdate(self.server_status))
265
266            # Update connections
267            if self.tcp_server:
268                # Use get_connections_info method instead of get_all_connections
269                connections_info = self.tcp_server.connection_manager.get_connections_info()
270                self.connections = connections_info
271                self.post_message(ConnectionUpdate(self.connections))
272
273            # Update logs (simplified for now)
274            # In a real implementation, this would integrate with the logging system
275
276            # Update server panel status
277            self._update_server_panel_status()
278
279        except Exception as e:
280            self.logger.error("Error updating UI data", error=str(e))
281
282    def _update_server_panel_status(self) -> None:
283        """Update the server panel status display."""
284        try:
285            # Debug: List all available panels
286            all_panels = self.query(ServerPanel)
287            self.logger.debug(
288                "Available server panels", count=len(all_panels), panels=[p.id for p in all_panels]
289            )
290
291            # Get the server panel - try multiple ways to find it
292            server_panel = None
293            try:
294                server_panel = self.query_one("#server-panel", ServerPanel)
295                self.logger.debug("Found server panel by ID")
296            except Exception as e:
297                self.logger.debug("Failed to find server panel by ID", error=str(e))
298                # Try to find it by class
299                try:
300                    server_panel = self.query_one(ServerPanel)
301                    self.logger.debug("Found server panel by class")
302                except Exception as e2:
303                    self.logger.debug("Failed to find server panel by class", error=str(e2))
304                    self.logger.warning("Server panel not found, skipping status update")
305                    return
306
307            if server_panel:
308                # Update the server panel with current status
309                server_panel.update_server_status(self.server_running)
310
311                # Update server statistics
312                stats = {
313                    "active_connections": 0,
314                    "total_requests": 0,
315                    "error_rate": 0.0,
316                }
317                server_panel.update_server_statistics(stats)
318
319                self.logger.debug("Updated server panel status", running=self.server_running)
320
321        except Exception as e:
322            self.logger.error("Error updating server panel status", error=str(e))
323
324    def _update_connection_panel(self) -> None:
325        """Update the connection panel with API keys and connections."""
326        try:
327            # Get the connection panel - try multiple ways to find it
328            connection_panel = None
329            try:
330                connection_panel = self.query_one("#connection-panel", ConnectionPanel)
331            except Exception:
332                # Try to find it by class
333                try:
334                    connection_panel = self.query_one(ConnectionPanel)
335                except Exception:
336                    self.logger.warning("Connection panel not found, skipping update")
337                    return
338
339            if connection_panel:
340                # Get API keys from the connection manager
341                api_keys = []
342                if self.tcp_server and hasattr(self.tcp_server, 'connection_manager'):
343                    try:
344                        api_keys = self.tcp_server.connection_manager.get_api_keys_info()
345                    except Exception as e:
346                        self.logger.error("Error getting API keys from connection manager", error=str(e))
347                        api_keys = []
348                
349                self.logger.debug(
350                    "Updating connection panel", api_keys_count=len(api_keys), api_keys=api_keys
351                )
352                connection_panel.update_api_keys(api_keys)
353                self.logger.debug("Connection panel update_api_keys called")
354
355                # Get connections from the connection manager
356                connections: list[dict[str, Any]] = []
357                if self.tcp_server and hasattr(self.tcp_server, 'connection_manager'):
358                    try:
359                        connections = self.tcp_server.connection_manager.get_connections_info()
360                        # Enhance connection data with additional information
361                        for conn in connections:
362                            # Add RPS and violations if not present
363                            if 'rps' not in conn:
364                                conn['rps'] = conn.get('requests_per_second', 0)
365                            if 'violations' not in conn:
366                                conn['violations'] = conn.get('rate_limit_violations', 0)
367                            
368                            # Ensure permissions are properly formatted
369                            if 'permissions' not in conn and 'api_key_permissions' in conn:
370                                conn['permissions'] = conn['api_key_permissions']
371                    except Exception as e:
372                        self.logger.error("Error getting connections from connection manager", error=str(e))
373                        connections = []
374                
375                connection_panel.update_connections(connections)
376
377                self.logger.debug(
378                    "Updated connection panel successfully", 
379                    api_keys_count=len(api_keys),
380                    connections_count=len(connections)
381                )
382
383        except Exception as e:
384            self.logger.error("Error updating connection panel", error=str(e))
385
386    def _add_log_entry(self, level: str, message: str) -> None:
387        """Add a log entry to the log panel."""
388        try:
389            # Debug: List all available log panels
390            all_log_panels = self.query(LogPanel)
391            self.logger.debug(
392                "Available log panels",
393                count=len(all_log_panels),
394                panels=[p.id for p in all_log_panels],
395            )
396
397            # Get the log panel - try multiple ways to find it
398            log_panel = None
399            try:
400                log_panel = self.query_one("#log-panel", LogPanel)
401                self.logger.debug("Found log panel by ID")
402            except Exception as e:
403                self.logger.debug("Failed to find log panel by ID", error=str(e))
404                # Try to find it by class
405                try:
406                    log_panel = self.query_one(LogPanel)
407                    self.logger.debug("Found log panel by class")
408                except Exception as e2:
409                    self.logger.debug("Failed to find log panel by class", error=str(e2))
410                    self.logger.warning("Log panel not found, skipping log entry")
411                    return
412
413            if log_panel:
414                # Create log entry
415                from datetime import datetime
416
417                log_entry = {
418                    "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
419                    "level": level,
420                    "message": message,
421                    "source": "tui",
422                }
423
424                # Add the log entry
425                self.logger.debug(
426                    "Adding log entry to panel", level=level, message=message, log_entry=log_entry
427                )
428                log_panel.add_log_entries([log_entry])
429
430                # Force update the display to bypass any filtering issues
431                try:
432                    log_panel._update_display()
433                    self.logger.debug("Forced log panel display update")
434                except Exception as e:
435                    self.logger.debug("Failed to force log panel update", error=str(e))
436
437                self.logger.debug("Added log entry successfully", level=level, message=message)
438
439        except Exception as e:
440            self.logger.error("Error adding log entry", error=str(e))

508    def _start_server(self) -> None:
509        """Start the TCP server."""
510        try:
511            self.logger.info("DEBUG: _start_server called")
512            print("DEBUG: Attempting to start TCP server...")
513
514            # Check if auto_start is enabled
515            print(
516                f"DEBUG: auto_start_server = {self.user_config.tui_settings.server_management.get('auto_start_server', False)}"
517            )
518
519            self.logger.info("Starting TCP server")
520
521            # Create server configuration
522            tcp_config = {
523                "port": self.server_port,
524                "bind_address": self.server_address,
525                "max_connections": self.user_config.tcp_transport_settings.max_connections,
526                "connection_timeout_seconds": self.user_config.tcp_transport_settings.connection_timeout_seconds,
527                "connection_management": {
528                    "api_key_management": self.user_config.tcp_transport_settings.api_key_management,
529                    "permissions": self.user_config.tcp_transport_settings.permissions,
530                },
531                "security": {
532                    "global_rate_limit": 1000,
533                    "global_burst_limit": 100,
534                    "client_rate_limit": self.user_config.tcp_transport_settings.api_key_management.get(
535                        "rate_limit_per_key", 60
536                    ),
537                    "client_burst_limit": 10,
538                    "abuse_threshold": 10,
539                    "block_duration_seconds": 3600,
540                    "max_connection_attempts": 5,
541                    "connection_window_seconds": 300,
542                    "input_validation": {
543                        "max_message_size": 1048576,
544                        "max_field_length": 10000,
545                        "allowed_methods": [
546                            "initialize",
547                            "initialized",
548                            "tools/list",
549                            "tools/call",
550                            "resources/list",
551                            "resources/read",
552                            "prompts/list",
553                            "prompts/get",
554                            "authenticate",
555                        ],
556                    },
557                },
558                "authentication": {
559                    "session_timeout_seconds": 3600,
560                    "max_sessions_per_key": 5,
561                },
562            }
563
564            # Create MCP server instance
565            mcp_server = self._create_mcp_server()
566
567            # Create and start the enhanced TCP server
568            self.tcp_server = EnhancedTCPServer(mcp_server, tcp_config)
569
570            # Start the server in a separate thread to avoid blocking the TUI
571            def start_server_async():
572                """Start the TCP server asynchronously."""
573                try:
574                    # Create a new event loop for this thread
575                    loop = asyncio.new_event_loop()
576                    asyncio.set_event_loop(loop)
577
578                    # Start the server
579                    loop.run_until_complete(self.tcp_server.start())
580
581                    # Keep the loop running
582                    loop.run_forever()
583
584                except Exception as e:
585                    self.logger.error("Error in TCP server thread", error=str(e))
586                finally:
587                    loop.close()
588
589            # Start the server in a daemon thread
590            self.server_thread = threading.Thread(target=start_server_async, daemon=True)
591            self.server_thread.start()
592
593            # Check if the server thread is actually running
594            if self.server_thread:
595                print(f"DEBUG: Server thread started: {self.server_thread.is_alive()}")
596                print(f"DEBUG: Server thread name: {self.server_thread.name}")
597
598            # Give the server a moment to start
599            import time
600
601            time.sleep(0.5)
602
603            self.server_running = True
604            self.logger.info("TCP server started successfully")
605            self.notify("Server started successfully", timeout=3)
606
607            # Update server panel status
608            self._update_server_panel_status()
609
610            # Add log entry
611            self._add_log_entry("info", "TCP server started successfully")
612
613        except Exception as e:
614            self.logger.error("Failed to start TCP server", error=str(e))
615            self.notify(f"Failed to start server: {e}", timeout=5)
616
617    def _stop_server(self) -> None:
618        """Stop the TCP server."""
619        try:
620            self.logger.info("Stopping TCP server")
621
622            if self.tcp_server:
623                # Stop the TCP server asynchronously
624                def stop_server_async():
625                    """Stop the TCP server asynchronously."""
626                    try:
627                        # Create a new event loop for this thread
628                        loop = asyncio.new_event_loop()
629                        asyncio.set_event_loop(loop)
630
631                        # Stop the server
632                        loop.run_until_complete(self.tcp_server.stop())
633
634                    except Exception as e:
635                        self.logger.error("Error stopping TCP server in thread", error=str(e))
636                    finally:
637                        loop.close()
638
639                # Stop the server in a separate thread
640                stop_thread = threading.Thread(target=stop_server_async, daemon=True)
641                stop_thread.start()
642                stop_thread.join(timeout=5)  # Wait up to 5 seconds for graceful shutdown
643
644                self.tcp_server = None
645
646            # Stop the server thread if it exists
647            if hasattr(self, "server_thread") and self.server_thread.is_alive():
648                # The thread will stop when the event loop is closed
649                pass
650
651            self.server_running = False
652            self.logger.info("TCP server stopped successfully")
653            self.notify("Server stopped", timeout=3)
654
655            # Update server panel status
656            self._update_server_panel_status()
657
658            # Add log entry
659            self._add_log_entry("info", "TCP server stopped successfully")
660
661        except Exception as e:
662            self.logger.error("Error stopping TCP server", error=str(e))
663            self.notify(f"Error stopping server: {e}", timeout=5)
664
665    def _create_mcp_server(self) -> Any:
666        """Create and initialize DShieldMCPServer instance.
667
668        Returns:
669            Initialized DShieldMCPServer instance
670
671        """
672        try:
673            # Get the DShieldMCPServer class using late import
674            DShieldMCPServer = _get_dshield_mcp_server()
675
676            # Create server instance
677            mcp_server = DShieldMCPServer()
678
679            # Initialize the server (this sets up all the components)
680            # Note: This is a synchronous call, but the server initialization
681            # should be done asynchronously in a real implementation
682            self.logger.info("Created DShieldMCPServer instance")
683
684            return mcp_server
685
686        except Exception as e:
687            self.logger.error("Failed to create DShieldMCPServer", error=str(e))
688            raise

690    async def _generate_api_key(self) -> None:
691        """Generate a new API key using the new API key management system."""
692        try:
693            if not self.server_running:
694                self.notify("Server must be running to generate API keys", timeout=3)
695                return
696
697            # Open the API key generation screen
698            from .screens.api_key_screen import APIKeyGenerationScreen
699
700            self.push_screen(APIKeyGenerationScreen(), self._on_api_key_generated)

706    async def _on_api_key_generated(self, key_config: dict[str, Any]) -> None:
707        """Handle API key generation completion."""
708        try:
709            if not self.server_running:
710                self.notify("Server must be running to generate API keys", timeout=3)
711                return
712
713            # Get the connection manager from the TCP server
714            connection_manager = getattr(self.tcp_server, "connection_manager", None)
715            if not connection_manager:
716                self.notify("Connection manager not available", severity="error")
717                return
718
719            # Generate the API key using the connection manager
720            api_key = await connection_manager.generate_api_key(
721                name=key_config["name"],
722                permissions=key_config["permissions"],
723                expiration_days=key_config["expiration_days"],
724                rate_limit=key_config["rate_limit"],
725            )
726
727            if api_key:
728                self.logger.info(
729                    "Generated new API key", key_id=api_key.key_id, name=key_config["name"]
730                )
731                self.notify(
732                    f"API Key generated: {key_config['name']} ({api_key.key_id})", timeout=5
733                )
734
735                # Add log entry for API key generation
736                self._add_log_entry(
737                    "info", f"API Key generated: {key_config['name']} ({api_key.key_id})"
738                )
739
740                # Update connection panel
741                self._update_connection_panel()
742            else:
743                self.notify("Failed to generate API key", severity="error")
744
745        except Exception as e:
746            self.logger.error("Failed to generate API key", error=str(e))
747            self.notify(f"Failed to generate API key: {e}", timeout=5)

800    async def _disconnect_connection(self, client_address: str | None) -> None:
801        """Disconnect a specific connection."""
802        try:
803            if not client_address:
804                self.notify("No client address provided", severity="error")
805                return
806
807            if not self.server_running:
808                self.notify("Server must be running to disconnect connections", timeout=3)
809                return
810
811            # Get the connection manager from the TCP server
812            connection_manager = getattr(self.tcp_server, "connection_manager", None)
813            if not connection_manager:
814                self.notify("Connection manager not available", severity="error")
815                return
816
817            # Find and disconnect the connection
818            connections = connection_manager.get_connections_info()
819            target_connection = None
820            
821            for conn in connections:
822                if str(conn.get("client_address", "")) == str(client_address):
823                    target_connection = conn
824                    break
825            
826            if not target_connection:
827                self.notify(f"Connection not found: {client_address}", severity="error")
828                return
829
830            # Disconnect the connection
831            # This would typically involve finding the actual connection object
832            # and calling a disconnect method on it
833            self.logger.info("Disconnecting connection", client_address=client_address)
834            self.notify(f"Disconnected connection: {client_address}", timeout=3)
835            
836            # Add log entry
837            self._add_log_entry("info", f"Disconnected connection: {client_address}")
838            
839            # Update connection panel
840            self._update_connection_panel()
841
842        except Exception as e:
843            self.logger.error("Failed to disconnect connection", error=str(e), client_address=client_address)
844            self.notify(f"Failed to disconnect connection: {e}", severity="error")
845
846    async def _revoke_api_key(self, key_id: str | None) -> None:
847        """Revoke an API key."""
848        try:
849            if not key_id:
850                self.notify("No API key ID provided", severity="error")
851                return
852
853            if not self.server_running:
854                self.notify("Server must be running to revoke API keys", timeout=3)
855                return
856
857            # Get the connection manager from the TCP server
858            connection_manager = getattr(self.tcp_server, "connection_manager", None)
859            if not connection_manager:
860                self.notify("Connection manager not available", severity="error")
861                return
862
863            # Revoke the API key
864            success = await connection_manager.delete_api_key(key_id)
865            if success:
866                self.logger.info("Revoked API key", key_id=key_id)
867                self.notify(f"API key {key_id} revoked successfully", timeout=3)
868                self._add_log_entry("info", f"API key {key_id} revoked")
869                # Update connection panel
870                self._update_connection_panel()
871            else:
872                self.notify(f"Failed to revoke API key {key_id}", severity="error")
873
874        except Exception as e:
875            self.logger.error("Failed to revoke API key", error=str(e))
876            self.notify(f"Failed to revoke API key: {e}", timeout=5)
877

class LogPanel(textual.containers.Container): 
 53class LogPanel(Container):  # type: ignore
 54    """Panel for displaying and managing logs.
 55
 56    This panel provides real-time log display with filtering, searching,
 57    and export capabilities.
 58    """
 59
 60    def __init__(self, id: str = "log-panel") -> None:
 61        """Initialize the log panel.
 62
 63        Args:
 64            id: Panel ID
 65
 66        """
 67        super().__init__(id=id)
 68        self.logger = structlog.get_logger(f"{__name__}.{self.__class__.__name__}")
 69
 70        # State
 71        self.log_entries: list[dict[str, Any]] = []
 72        self.filtered_entries: list[dict[str, Any]] = []
 73        self.max_entries = 1000  # Maximum number of log entries to keep
 74        self.filter_config: dict[str, Any] = {
 75            "levels": {"DEBUG", "INFO", "WARNING", "ERROR", "CRITICAL"},
 76            "search_text": "",
 77            "show_timestamps": True,
 78            "show_levels": True,
 79            "show_sources": True,
 80        }
 81
 82    def compose(self) -> ComposeResult:
 83        """Compose the log panel layout.
 84
 85        Returns:
 86            ComposeResult: The composed UI elements
 87
 88        """
 89        yield Static("Log Monitor", classes="panel-title")
 90
 91        with Vertical(classes="panel"):
 92            # Log controls
 93            with Horizontal(classes="log-controls"):
 94                yield Button("Clear Logs", id="clear-logs-btn")
 95                yield Button("Export Logs", id="export-logs-btn")
 96                yield Button("Auto-scroll", id="auto-scroll-btn", variant="primary")
 97                yield Button("Pause", id="pause-logs-btn")
 98
 99            # Filter controls
100            with Horizontal(classes="filter-controls"):
101                yield Static("Levels:")
102                yield Checkbox("DEBUG", id="filter-debug", value=True)
103                yield Checkbox("INFO", id="filter-info", value=True)
104                yield Checkbox("WARNING", id="filter-warning", value=True)
105                yield Checkbox("ERROR", id="filter-error", value=True)
106                yield Checkbox("CRITICAL", id="filter-critical", value=True)
107
108            with Horizontal(classes="search-controls"):
109                yield Static("Search:")
110                yield Input(placeholder="Search logs...", id="search-input")
111                yield Button("Clear Search", id="clear-search-btn")
112
113            # Display options
114            with Horizontal(classes="display-controls"):
115                yield Checkbox("Show Timestamps", id="show-timestamps", value=True)
116                yield Checkbox("Show Levels", id="show-levels", value=True)
117                yield Checkbox("Show Sources", id="show-sources", value=True)
118
119            # Log display
120            yield Static("Log Entries:", classes="section-title")
121            yield TextArea(id="log-display", read_only=True)
122
123    def on_mount(self) -> None:
124        """Handle panel mount event."""
125        self.logger.debug("Log panel mounted")
126
127        # Initialize log display
128        log_display = self.query_one("#log-display", TextArea)
129        log_display.text = "Log monitor ready. Waiting for log entries...\n"
130
131    def add_log_entries(self, entries: list[dict[str, Any]]) -> None:
132        """Add new log entries to the display.
133
134        Args:
135            entries: List of log entries to add
136
137        """
138        self.logger.debug("add_log_entries called", entries_count=len(entries), entries=entries)
139
140        for entry in entries:
141            self.log_entries.append(entry)
142
143        # Limit the number of entries
144        if len(self.log_entries) > self.max_entries:
145            self.log_entries = self.log_entries[-self.max_entries :]
146
147        self.logger.debug(
148            "Applied filters and updating display", total_entries=len(self.log_entries)
149        )
150
151        # Apply filters and update display
152        self._apply_filters()
153        self._update_display()
154
155        self.logger.debug(
156            "Added log entries",
157            count=len(entries),
158            total=len(self.log_entries),
159            filtered=len(self.filtered_entries),
160        )
161
162    def clear_logs(self) -> None:
163        """Clear all log entries."""
164        self.log_entries.clear()
165        self.filtered_entries.clear()
166
167        log_display = self.query_one("#log-display", TextArea)
168        log_display.text = "Logs cleared.\n"
169
170        self.logger.info("Cleared all log entries")
171
172    def _apply_filters(self) -> None:
173        """Apply current filters to log entries."""
174        self.filtered_entries = []
175
176        for entry in self.log_entries:
177            # Check level filter
178            level = entry.get("level", "INFO")
179            if isinstance(level, str):
180                level = level.upper()
181            else:
182                level = "INFO"
183
184            filter_levels = self.filter_config["levels"]
185            if isinstance(filter_levels, set) and level not in filter_levels:
186                continue
187
188            # Check search filter
189            search_text = self.filter_config["search_text"]
190            if isinstance(search_text, str):
191                search_text = search_text.lower()
192                if search_text:
193                    entry_text = str(entry).lower()
194                    if search_text not in entry_text:
195                        continue
196
197            self.filtered_entries.append(entry)
198
199    def _update_display(self) -> None:
200        """Update the log display with filtered entries."""
201        log_display = self.query_one("#log-display", TextArea)
202
203        # Build display text
204        display_lines = []
205        for entry in self.filtered_entries[-100:]:  # Show last 100 filtered entries
206            line = self._format_log_entry(entry)
207            display_lines.append(line)
208
209        # Update display
210        log_display.text = "\n".join(display_lines)
211
212        # Auto-scroll to bottom if enabled
213        auto_scroll_btn = self.query_one("#auto-scroll-btn", Button)
214        if auto_scroll_btn.variant == "primary":
215            log_display.scroll_end()
216
217    def _format_log_entry(self, entry: dict[str, Any]) -> str:
218        """Format a log entry for display.
219
220        Args:
221            entry: Log entry dictionary
222
223        Returns:
224            Formatted log entry string
225
226        """
227        parts = []
228
229        # Add timestamp if enabled
230        if self.filter_config["show_timestamps"]:
231            timestamp = entry.get("timestamp", datetime.now().isoformat())
232            if isinstance(timestamp, str):
233                # Format timestamp for display
234                try:
235                    dt = datetime.fromisoformat(timestamp.replace("Z", "+00:00"))
236                    timestamp = dt.strftime("%H:%M:%S")
237                except (ValueError, TypeError):
238                    pass
239            parts.append(f"[{timestamp}]")
240
241        # Add level if enabled
242        if self.filter_config["show_levels"]:
243            level = entry.get("level", "INFO")
244            parts.append(f"[{level}]")
245
246        # Add source if enabled
247        if self.filter_config["show_sources"]:
248            source = entry.get("source", "")
249            if source:
250                parts.append(f"[{source}]")
251
252        # Add message
253        message = entry.get("message", str(entry))
254        parts.append(message)
255
256        return " ".join(parts)
257
258    def on_button_pressed(self, event: Button.Pressed) -> None:
259        """Handle button press events.
260
261        Args:
262            event: Button press event
263
264        """
265        button_id = event.button.id
266
267        if button_id == "clear-logs-btn":
268            self._clear_logs()
269        elif button_id == "export-logs-btn":
270            self._export_logs()
271        elif button_id == "auto-scroll-btn":
272            self._toggle_auto_scroll()
273        elif button_id == "pause-logs-btn":
274            self._toggle_pause()
275        elif button_id == "clear-search-btn":
276            self._clear_search()
277
278    def on_checkbox_changed(self, event: Checkbox.Changed) -> None:
279        """Handle checkbox change events.
280
281        Args:
282            event: Checkbox change event
283
284        """
285        checkbox_id = event.checkbox.id
286
287        if checkbox_id.startswith("filter-"):
288            level = checkbox_id.replace("filter-", "").upper()
289            filter_levels = self.filter_config["levels"]
290            if isinstance(filter_levels, set):
291                if event.checkbox.value:
292                    filter_levels.add(level)
293                else:
294                    filter_levels.discard(level)
295
296            self._apply_filters()
297            self._update_display()
298
299        elif checkbox_id == "show-timestamps":
300            self.filter_config["show_timestamps"] = event.checkbox.value
301            self._update_display()
302        elif checkbox_id == "show-levels":
303            self.filter_config["show_levels"] = event.checkbox.value
304            self._update_display()
305        elif checkbox_id == "show-sources":
306            self.filter_config["show_sources"] = event.checkbox.value
307            self._update_display()
308
309    def on_input_changed(self, event: Input.Changed) -> None:
310        """Handle input field changes.
311
312        Args:
313            event: Input change event
314
315        """
316        if event.input.id == "search-input":
317            self.filter_config["search_text"] = event.input.value
318            self._apply_filters()
319            self._update_display()
320
321    def _clear_logs(self) -> None:
322        """Clear all logs."""
323        self.logger.info("Clearing logs")
324        self.post_message(LogClear())
325        self.clear_logs()
326
327    def _export_logs(self) -> None:
328        """Export logs to file."""
329        # This would typically open a file dialog
330        # For now, we'll use a default path
331        export_path = f"dshield_mcp_logs_{datetime.now().strftime('%Y%m%d_%H%M%S')}.log"
332        self.logger.info("Exporting logs", path=export_path)
333        self.post_message(LogExport(export_path))
334
335    def _toggle_auto_scroll(self) -> None:
336        """Toggle auto-scroll mode."""
337        auto_scroll_btn = self.query_one("#auto-scroll-btn", Button)
338        if auto_scroll_btn.variant == "primary":
339            auto_scroll_btn.variant = "default"
340            auto_scroll_btn.label = "Auto-scroll"
341        else:
342            auto_scroll_btn.variant = "primary"
343            auto_scroll_btn.label = "Auto-scroll "
344
345        self.logger.debug("Toggled auto-scroll")
346
347    def _toggle_pause(self) -> None:
348        """Toggle log pause mode."""
349        pause_btn = self.query_one("#pause-logs-btn", Button)
350        if pause_btn.variant == "primary":
351            pause_btn.variant = "default"
352            pause_btn.label = "Pause"
353        else:
354            pause_btn.variant = "primary"
355            pause_btn.label = "Paused"
356
357        self.logger.debug("Toggled log pause")
358
359    def _clear_search(self) -> None:
360        """Clear search input."""
361        search_input = self.query_one("#search-input", Input)
362        search_input.value = ""
363        self.filter_config["search_text"] = ""
364        self._apply_filters()
365        self._update_display()
366
367    def get_log_statistics(self) -> dict[str, Any]:
368        """Get log statistics.
369
370        Returns:
371            Dictionary of log statistics
372
373        """
374        total_entries = len(self.log_entries)
375        filtered_entries = len(self.filtered_entries)
376
377        # Count by level
378        level_counts: dict[str, int] = {}
379        for entry in self.log_entries:
380            level = entry.get("level", "INFO")
381            level_counts[level] = level_counts.get(level, 0) + 1
382
383        return {
384            "total_entries": total_entries,
385            "filtered_entries": filtered_entries,
386            "level_counts": level_counts,
387            "filter_config": self.filter_config,
388            "max_entries": self.max_entries,
389        }
390
391    def set_max_entries(self, max_entries: int) -> None:
392        """Set maximum number of log entries to keep.
393
394        Args:
395            max_entries: Maximum number of entries
396
397        """
398        self.max_entries = max_entries
399
400        # Trim entries if necessary
401        if len(self.log_entries) > max_entries:
402            self.log_entries = self.log_entries[-max_entries:]
403            self._apply_filters()
404            self._update_display()
405
406        self.logger.debug("Set max log entries", max_entries=max_entries)

126    def _initialize_config_display(self) -> None:
127        """Initialize configuration display with effective configuration."""
128        try:
129            config = self.process_manager.get_effective_configuration()
130
131            # Update configuration display
132            port_text = self.query_one("#config-port-text", Static)
133            address_text = self.query_one("#config-address-text", Static)
134            max_connections_text = self.query_one("#config-max-connections-text", Static)
135            timeout_text = self.query_one("#config-timeout-text", Static)
136            api_keys_text = self.query_one("#config-api-keys-text", Static)
137            rate_limit_text = self.query_one("#config-rate-limit-text", Static)
138
139            port_text.update(f"Port: {config.get('port', 'N/A')}")
140            address_text.update(f"Bind Address: {config.get('bind_address', 'N/A')}")
141            max_connections_text.update(f"Max Connections: {config.get('max_connections', 'N/A')}")
142            timeout_text.update(
143                f"Graceful Shutdown Timeout: {config.get('graceful_shutdown_timeout', 'N/A')}s"
144            )
145
146            api_key_mgmt = config.get("api_key_management", {})
147            enabled_status = "Enabled" if api_key_mgmt.get("enabled", False) else "Disabled"
148            api_keys_text.update(f"API Key Management: {enabled_status}")
149            rate_limit_text.update(
150                f"Rate Limit per Key: {api_key_mgmt.get('rate_limit_per_key', 'N/A')} req/min"
151            )
152
153            self.logger.debug("Initialized configuration display", config=config)
154
155        except Exception as e:
156            self.logger.error("Error initializing configuration display", error=str(e))
157
158    def _update_server_status(self) -> None:
159        """Update server status from process manager."""
160        try:
161            status = self.process_manager.get_server_status()
162            self.server_running = status.get("running", False)
163            self.server_status = status
164
165            # Update button states
166            start_btn = self.query_one("#start-server-btn", Button)
167            stop_btn = self.query_one("#stop-server-btn", Button)
168            restart_btn = self.query_one("#restart-server-btn", Button)
169
170            start_btn.disabled = bool(self.server_running)
171            stop_btn.disabled = not self.server_running
172            restart_btn.disabled = not self.server_running
173
174            # Update status text
175            status_text = self.query_one("#server-status-text", Static)
176            if self.server_running:
177                status_text.update("Status: Running")
178                if not self.uptime_start:
179                    self.uptime_start = datetime.now()
180            else:
181                status_text.update("Status: Stopped")
182                self.uptime_start = None
183
184            # Update uptime
185            uptime_text = self.query_one("#server-uptime-text", Static)
186            if self.server_running and self.uptime_start:
187                uptime = datetime.now() - self.uptime_start
188                uptime_str = str(uptime).split(".")[0]  # Remove microseconds
189                uptime_text.update(f"Uptime: {uptime_str}")
190            else:
191                uptime_text.update("Uptime: N/A")
192
193            # Update port and address
194            port_text = self.query_one("#server-port-text", Static)
195            address_text = self.query_one("#server-address-text", Static)
196
197            config = status.get("configuration", {})
198            port_text.update(f"Port: {config.get('port', 'N/A')}")
199            address_text.update(f"Address: {config.get('bind_address', 'N/A')}")
200
201            self.logger.debug("Updated server status", running=self.server_running, status=status)
202
203        except Exception as e:
204            self.logger.error("Error updating server status", error=str(e))
205

313    def _start_server(self) -> None:
314        """Start the server."""
315        self.logger.info("Starting server")
316        
317        # Disable buttons during operation
318        start_btn = self.query_one("#start-server-btn", Button)
319        stop_btn = self.query_one("#stop-server-btn", Button)
320        restart_btn = self.query_one("#restart-server-btn", Button)
321        
322        start_btn.disabled = True
323        stop_btn.disabled = True
324        restart_btn.disabled = True
325        
326        # Start server asynchronously
327        import asyncio
328        asyncio.create_task(self._async_start_server())
329
330    def _stop_server(self) -> None:
331        """Stop the server."""
332        self.logger.info("Stopping server")
333        
334        # Disable buttons during operation
335        start_btn = self.query_one("#start-server-btn", Button)
336        stop_btn = self.query_one("#stop-server-btn", Button)
337        restart_btn = self.query_one("#restart-server-btn", Button)
338        
339        start_btn.disabled = True
340        stop_btn.disabled = True
341        restart_btn.disabled = True
342        
343        # Stop server asynchronously
344        import asyncio
345        asyncio.create_task(self._async_stop_server())
346
347    def _restart_server(self) -> None:
348        """Restart the server."""
349        self.logger.info("Restarting server")
350        
351        # Disable buttons during operation
352        start_btn = self.query_one("#start-server-btn", Button)
353        stop_btn = self.query_one("#stop-server-btn", Button)
354        restart_btn = self.query_one("#restart-server-btn", Button)
355        
356        start_btn.disabled = True
357        stop_btn.disabled = True
358        restart_btn.disabled = True
359        
360        # Restart server asynchronously
361        import asyncio
362        asyncio.create_task(self._async_restart_server())
363
364    async def _async_start_server(self) -> None:
365        """Asynchronously start the server."""
366        try:
367            success = await self.process_manager.start_server()
368            if success:
369                self.logger.info("Server started successfully")
370            else:
371                self.logger.error("Failed to start server")
372        except Exception as e:
373            self.logger.error("Error starting server", error=str(e))
374        finally:
375            # Re-enable buttons
376            self._update_server_status()
377
378    async def _async_stop_server(self) -> None:
379        """Asynchronously stop the server."""
380        try:
381            success = await self.process_manager.stop_server()
382            if success:
383                self.logger.info("Server stopped successfully")
384            else:
385                self.logger.error("Failed to stop server")
386        except Exception as e:
387            self.logger.error("Error stopping server", error=str(e))
388        finally:
389            # Re-enable buttons
390            self._update_server_status()
391
392    async def _async_restart_server(self) -> None:
393        """Asynchronously restart the server."""
394        try:
395            success = await self.process_manager.restart_server()
396            if success:
397                self.logger.info("Server restarted successfully")
398            else:
399                self.logger.error("Failed to restart server")
400        except Exception as e:
401            self.logger.error("Error restarting server", error=str(e))
402        finally:
403            # Re-enable buttons
404            self._update_server_status()
405
406    def get_server_health(self) -> dict[str, Any]:
407        """Get server health information.
408
409        Returns:
410            Dictionary of server health information
411
412        """
413        return {
414            "running": self.server_running,
415            "uptime_seconds": (datetime.now() - self.uptime_start).total_seconds()
416            if self.uptime_start
417            else 0,
418            "status": self.server_status,
419            "configuration": self.process_manager.get_effective_configuration(),
420        }
