class StatusBar(textual.widgets._static.Static): 
 20class StatusBar(Static):  # type: ignore
 21    """Status bar widget for displaying real-time status information.
 22
 23    This widget shows server status, connection counts, system metrics,
 24    and other relevant information in a compact format.
 25    """
 26
 27    def __init__(self, id: str = "status-bar") -> None:
 28        """Initialize the status bar.
 29
 30        Args:
 31            id: Widget ID
 32
 33        """
 34        super().__init__(id=id)
 35        self.logger = structlog.get_logger(f"{__name__}.{self.__class__.__name__}")
 36
 37        # Status information
 38        self.server_status: dict[str, Any] = {}
 39        self.connection_count = reactive(0)
 40        self.authenticated_count = reactive(0)
 41        self.api_key_count = reactive(0)
 42        self.error_count = reactive(0)
 43        self.last_update = reactive(datetime.now())
 44
 45    def on_mount(self) -> None:
 46        """Handle widget mount event."""
 47        self.logger.debug("Status bar mounted")
 48        self.update_display()
 49
 50    def update_server_status(self, status: dict[str, Any]) -> None:
 51        """Update server status information.
 52
 53        Args:
 54            status: Server status dictionary
 55
 56        """
 57        self.server_status = status
 58        self.last_update = datetime.now()
 59
 60        # Extract connection information
 61        connections = status.get("connections", {})
 62        self.connection_count = connections.get("active", 0)
 63
 64        # Extract API key information
 65        connection_manager = status.get("connection_manager", {})
 66        api_keys = connection_manager.get("api_keys", {})
 67        self.api_key_count = api_keys.get("total", 0)
 68
 69        # Extract error information
 70        security = status.get("security", {})
 71        abuse_detection = security.get("abuse_detection", {})
 72        self.error_count = abuse_detection.get("total_violations", 0)
 73
 74        self.update_display()
 75        self.logger.debug("Updated server status", status=status)
 76
 77    def update_connection_count(self, total: int, authenticated: int) -> None:
 78        """Update connection count information.
 79
 80        Args:
 81            total: Total number of connections
 82            authenticated: Number of authenticated connections
 83
 84        """
 85        self.connection_count = total
 86        self.authenticated_count = authenticated
 87        self.update_display()
 88        self.logger.debug("Updated connection count", total=total, authenticated=authenticated)
 89
 90    def update_api_key_count(self, count: int) -> None:
 91        """Update API key count information.
 92
 93        Args:
 94            count: Number of API keys
 95
 96        """
 97        self.api_key_count = count
 98        self.update_display()
 99        self.logger.debug("Updated API key count", count=count)
100
101    def update_error_count(self, count: int) -> None:
102        """Update error count information.
103
104        Args:
105            count: Number of errors
106
107        """
108        self.error_count = count
109        self.update_display()
110        self.logger.debug("Updated error count", count=count)
111
112    def update_display(self) -> None:
113        """Update the status bar display."""
114        try:
115            # Build status information
116            status_parts = []
117
118            # Server status
119            server_info = self.server_status.get("server", {})
120            if server_info.get("is_running", False):
121                status_parts.append(" Server: Running")
122                port = server_info.get("port", "N/A")
123                address = server_info.get("bind_address", "N/A")
124                status_parts.append(f"Port: {port}")
125                status_parts.append(f"Address: {address}")
126            else:
127                status_parts.append(" Server: Stopped")
128
129            # Connection information
130            status_parts.append(f"Connections: {self.connection_count}")
131            if self.authenticated_count > 0:
132                status_parts.append(f"Auth: {self.authenticated_count}")
133
134            # API key information
135            if self.api_key_count > 0:
136                status_parts.append(f"API Keys: {self.api_key_count}")
137
138            # Error information
139            if self.error_count > 0:
140                status_parts.append(f"Errors: {self.error_count}")
141
142            # Last update time
143            update_time = self.last_update.strftime("%H:%M:%S")
144            status_parts.append(f"Updated: {update_time}")
145
146            # Join all parts
147            status_text = " | ".join(status_parts)
148
149            # Update the display
150            self.update(status_text)
151
152        except Exception as e:
153            self.logger.error("Error updating status bar display", error=str(e))
154            self.update("Status: Error")
155
156    def watch_connection_count(self, count: int) -> None:
157        """Watch for connection count changes.
158
159        Args:
160            count: New connection count
161
162        """
163        self.update_display()
164
165    def watch_authenticated_count(self, count: int) -> None:
166        """Watch for authenticated count changes.
167
168        Args:
169            count: New authenticated count
170
171        """
172        self.update_display()
173
174    def watch_api_key_count(self, count: int) -> None:
175        """Watch for API key count changes.
176
177        Args:
178            count: New API key count
179
180        """
181        self.update_display()
182
183    def watch_error_count(self, count: int) -> None:
184        """Watch for error count changes.
185
186        Args:
187            count: New error count
188
189        """
190        self.update_display()
191
192    def watch_last_update(self, update_time: datetime) -> None:
193        """Watch for last update time changes.
194
195        Args:
196            update_time: New update time
197
198        """
199        self.update_display()
200
201    def get_status_summary(self) -> dict[str, Any]:
202        """Get a summary of current status information.
203
204        Returns:
205            Dictionary of status summary
206
207        """
208        return {
209            "server_running": self.server_status.get("server", {}).get("is_running", False),
210            "connection_count": self.connection_count,
211            "authenticated_count": self.authenticated_count,
212            "api_key_count": self.api_key_count,
213            "error_count": self.error_count,
214            "last_update": self.last_update.isoformat(),
215            "server_status": self.server_status,
216        }
217
218    def set_status_message(self, message: str, timeout: float | None = None) -> None:
219        """Set a temporary status message.
220
221        Args:
222            message: Status message to display
223            timeout: Optional timeout in seconds to revert to normal status
224
225        """
226        self.update(message)
227
228        if timeout:
229            # Schedule revert to normal status
230            import asyncio
231
232            asyncio.create_task(self._revert_status_after_timeout(timeout))
233
234        self.logger.debug("Set status message", message=message, timeout=timeout)
235
236    async def _revert_status_after_timeout(self, timeout: float) -> None:
237        """Revert status message after timeout.
238
239        Args:
240            timeout: Timeout in seconds
241
242        """
243        await asyncio.sleep(timeout)
244        self.update_display()
245
246    def add_status_indicator(self, indicator: str, value: Any) -> None:
247        """Add a status indicator to the display.
248
249        Args:
250            indicator: Indicator name
251            value: Indicator value
252
253        """
254        # This would be used to add custom status indicators
255        # For now, we'll just log it
256        self.logger.debug("Added status indicator", indicator=indicator, value=value)
257
258    def remove_status_indicator(self, indicator: str) -> None:
259        """Remove a status indicator from the display.
260
261        Args:

Status bar widget for displaying real-time status information.

This widget shows server status, connection counts, system metrics, and other relevant information in a compact format.

def update_server_status(self, status: dict[str, typing.Any]) -> None: 
50    def update_server_status(self, status: dict[str, Any]) -> None:
51        """Update server status information.
52
53        Args:
54            status: Server status dictionary
55
56        """
57        self.server_status = status
58        self.last_update = datetime.now()
59
60        # Extract connection information
61        connections = status.get("connections", {})
62        self.connection_count = connections.get("active", 0)
63
64        # Extract API key information
65        connection_manager = status.get("connection_manager", {})
66        api_keys = connection_manager.get("api_keys", {})
67        self.api_key_count = api_keys.get("total", 0)
68
69        # Extract error information
70        security = status.get("security", {})
71        abuse_detection = security.get("abuse_detection", {})
72        self.error_count = abuse_detection.get("total_violations", 0)
73
74        self.update_display()
75        self.logger.debug("Updated server status", status=status)

Update server status information.

Args: status: Server status dictionary

def update_display(self) -> None: 
112    def update_display(self) -> None:
113        """Update the status bar display."""
114        try:
115            # Build status information
116            status_parts = []
117
118            # Server status
119            server_info = self.server_status.get("server", {})
120            if server_info.get("is_running", False):
121                status_parts.append(" Server: Running")
122                port = server_info.get("port", "N/A")
123                address = server_info.get("bind_address", "N/A")
124                status_parts.append(f"Port: {port}")
125                status_parts.append(f"Address: {address}")
126            else:
127                status_parts.append(" Server: Stopped")
128
129            # Connection information
130            status_parts.append(f"Connections: {self.connection_count}")
131            if self.authenticated_count > 0:
132                status_parts.append(f"Auth: {self.authenticated_count}")
133
134            # API key information
135            if self.api_key_count > 0:
136                status_parts.append(f"API Keys: {self.api_key_count}")
137
138            # Error information
139            if self.error_count > 0:
140                status_parts.append(f"Errors: {self.error_count}")
141
142            # Last update time
143            update_time = self.last_update.strftime("%H:%M:%S")
144            status_parts.append(f"Updated: {update_time}")
145
146            # Join all parts
147            status_text = " | ".join(status_parts)
148
149            # Update the display
150            self.update(status_text)
151
152        except Exception as e:
153            self.logger.error("Error updating status bar display", error=str(e))
154            self.update("Status: Error")

Update the status bar display.

def get_status_summary(self) -> dict[str, typing.Any]: 
201    def get_status_summary(self) -> dict[str, Any]:
202        """Get a summary of current status information.
203
204        Returns:
205            Dictionary of status summary
206
207        """
208        return {
209            "server_running": self.server_status.get("server", {}).get("is_running", False),
210            "connection_count": self.connection_count,
211            "authenticated_count": self.authenticated_count,
212            "api_key_count": self.api_key_count,
213            "error_count": self.error_count,
214            "last_update": self.last_update.isoformat(),
215            "server_status": self.server_status,
216        }

Get a summary of current status information.

Returns: Dictionary of status summary

def set_status_message(self, message: str, timeout: float | None = None) -> None: 
218    def set_status_message(self, message: str, timeout: float | None = None) -> None:
219        """Set a temporary status message.
220
221        Args:
222            message: Status message to display
223            timeout: Optional timeout in seconds to revert to normal status
224
225        """
226        self.update(message)
227
228        if timeout:
229            # Schedule revert to normal status
230            import asyncio
231
232            asyncio.create_task(self._revert_status_after_timeout(timeout))
233
234        self.logger.debug("Set status message", message=message, timeout=timeout)

Set a temporary status message.

Args: message: Status message to display timeout: Optional timeout in seconds to revert to normal status
